comments: Dr. Ayres was a good professor. Study every day and memorize all the mechanisms he gives you if you want to get an A. The grading scale was very vague. He claimed that he did not curve, however it was not clearly stated what you need to get an A,B,C, etc.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Dr. Ayres is a very nice man. He explains difficult OChem topics well in lecture, but his exams are extremely tough. A lot of the time recitation quizzes can be found on UTDallas\'s website, but his exams are hit or miss. Study outside of class every single day if you plan on getting an A.

comments: First day of class: "you get what you get". Does not disclose grading scale. Do not take if you cannot read PowerPoint slide in 1.5 seconds. He is pretty terrible.

comments: He changed his teaching style this year; he lectures off powerpoints and does examples in class. He explains things easily and cares about his students. Of course with orgo you have to work hard, but he tries to help you out the best he can.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Note: TA\'s make the big difference in this class and his helpfulness as rated with them in account. Your experience may vary. You have to work for it but he is a capable professor, especially for Organic Chemistry. IMPORTANT: if you do not learn well through packets and example learning, you are going to struggle.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Ayres is a unique professor. He does not lecture you to death. He only lectured for 2 days out of the semester. He has the students learn the material on their own which worked best for me. WHAT HE TEACHES IS ON HIS EXAMS. He is 10 times better than any other organic professor. He is not monotone when he speaks and actually helps students in class

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Doesn\'t teach and gives a ChemActivity packet that you work on it with a group during class. RA\'s are the ones that teach once a week during recitation (which they can\'t explain anything). Basically, it\'s a self-teaching yourself type of class. Very harsh graders and take points off the smallest things. DON\'T RECOMMEND, Doesn\'t curve!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Ayres is the worst professor I have ever had. He does not teach AT ALL during your lecture. He gives out to the entire class a Chem Activity packet each week that\'s about 50 pages and he wants you to work on that the entire class period. The only lecture you receive is from graduate students in Recitation. Would never recommend him to anyone!

comments: Dr. Ayres is seriously one of the best professors in the chemistry department. It\'s a shame I had to take ochem 1 over again, but I\'m extremely thankful I got Dr. Ayres as my professor the second time around!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: I HATED ORGANIC CHEMISTRY! But Dr. Ayres made it enjoyable. He is always willing to assist students in their learning. I got a B-, not the best grade but this could be attributed to never looking at the book. Well I saw the front page. & advice for future students; ATTEND every class and listen to Dr. Ayres. you will be fine.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: If you are willing to practice the problems from the book, you will do fine in his class. He also explains everything very nicely.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: He is an exceptional Organic Chem professor. O chem isn\'t an easy class, but Dr. Ayres breaks it down into simple elements for you. Great one on one time and showed genuine interest in your progress. Very polite and seems to love O Chem. Doesn\'t offer practical elements like Dr. Lieberman, but will make getting through O Chem much easier. A++++

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Organic chemistry is just hard..plain and simple. It\'s not a subject you can cram for. Dr. Ayres did not offer partial credit on his quizzes and exams; however, he was great one-on-one. He was always willing to work with you outside the classroom whenever you needed him to.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Very very very easy compared to Dr. Lieberman. I would always take this professor for Organic Chemistry, he makes the course waaaayy easier than other professors. Come to class to get the PRS points because they are important. Midterm was quite easy, however he is very big on mechanisms on the final. Good luck. If you study, you do good.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Dr. Ayres is the best professor I have ever had. He is very good at explaining everything, and does a great job of giving you the bigger picture of organic chemistry (especially when it comes to reaction mechanisms). Also, Dr. Ayres is hilarious. I can honestly say that I liked coming to O-chem class with Dr. Ayres as the professor.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Dr. Ayers is the BEST professor i\'ve had so far at UC. He takes time in class to go over examples, he makes sure everyone in the class has an understanding of a concept before he moves on. Ayers doesn\'t curve, but if you go to class and put in a good amount of effort ouside of class, you\'ll be just fine!

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: This is seriously the best teacher I\'ve ever had. Chemistry is a hard class to teach, but Ayres does it in a way that really helps you understand wtf you\'re doing. He goes over examples on the board everyday and spends hardly any time on powerpoints. If anyone fails this class it\'s for a lack of trying on their part, not the teachers.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: One of the best teachers at UC I have had. I took a graduate level Polymer and because of Dr. Ayres I know if i go on ever to graduate school I will go into polymer. He really made the chemistry to interesting. I hope he rises to the top of the department because teachers like him should get the credit they deserve.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Love him! Organic Chem is hard but I like his class. He does lots of in class examples and has patience if you don\'t understand something. Very flexible and is helpful. Tests are hard but that\'s chem. He also has a sweet irish/scottish? accent which makes him fun to listen to :) Good class.
